m50z | In a clinical trial conclusions are based on observed treatment effects rather than the true, unknown effects. These observed effects could be larger but could also be smaller than the true effects. The trials need to give a good chance of providing evidence for a treatment difference even if the observed effects are smaller than the true effects. The chances of this can be improved by increasing the numbers in our trial.
